description: Mostly likely a back-etymology of pot, to form crack +‎ pot. Originally, from crack +‎ pate.

adjectives.description: crackpot (comparative more crackpot, superlative most crackpot)

entries.meaning: (informal) An eccentric, crazy or foolish person.
examples: Synonyms: crank, crazy, kook, live one, nut ball, nutbag, nutbar, nutcase, nutter; see also Thesaurus:strange person, Thesaurus:mad person
Time will tell whether he is a crackpot or a genius for promoting that sort of idea.

entries.meaning: (informal) Someone addicted to crack cocaine (i.e. a drug addict).
examples: Synonyms: crackhead, crack whore; see also Thesaurus:addict
